mp3player.desktopaudio

Interface MediaFile

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalMediaFile

    public interface MediaFile
    A MediaFile represents a media, usually sound, file either stored locally or accessible on some server. The audio data in the file is stored in an encoded format like MP3, WAVE, etc.

    Only file information as well as a file InputStream can be obtained through the MediaFile interface. In situations where the media format is already known, the MediaStream interface should be used instead.

    Author:
    Philipp Holl

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.File getFile()
      Returns a local file in which the media is stored or null if none exists.
      java.lang.String getFileName()
      Returns the name of the file that stores the media.
      long getFileSize()
      Returns the file size in bytes or -1 if unknown.
      java.io.InputStream openStream()
      Reads the media as a file, ignoring all format information.
      java.net.URI toURI()
      If the media is stored locally or on an openly accessible server, this method returns the location, otherwise null.

    • Method Detail

      • openStream

        java.io.InputStream openStream()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the media as a file, ignoring all format information.
        Returns:
        an InputStream for the media file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the media is not available

      • getFile

        java.io.File getFile()
        Returns a local file in which the media is stored or null if none exists.
        Returns:
        a local file in which the media is stored or null if none exists

      • getFileName

        java.lang.String getFileName()
        Returns the name of the file that stores the media. This method never returns null, even if the media is not stored anywhere.
        Returns:
        the filename

      • toURI

        java.net.URI toURI()
        If the media is stored locally or on an openly accessible server, this method returns the location, otherwise null.
        Returns:
        the media location or null if not available.

      • getFileSize

        long getFileSize()
        Returns the file size in bytes or -1 if unknown.
        Returns:
        the file size in bytes or -1 if unknown
